result.execSummary:
The defendant Amy Rivera was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Penalty - Retail Theft (<=$500)], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Penalty - Retail Theft (<=$500)], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Penalty - Retail Theft (<=$500)], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.
$100 fine plus costs on each count.   (fine and costs have been paid in full) To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.
Restitution and any statutorily authorized surcharges have been paid in full to the District Attorney's office.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amy Rivera

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Amy Rivera in court with attorney Shane Laughton Brabazon.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, reviews State's motion to vacate DAGPA. State advises of compliance with conditions of agreement, State moves to amend Ct. 2 to Misdemeanor Retail Theft. Defendant enters no contest plea to amended Ct. 2. Court finds defendant guilty of amended charge, imposes fine/costs in which defendant has already paid. Bond is no longer in effect.

Attorney Shane Laughton Brabazon in court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, reviews State's motion to vacate deferred agreement. Court questions Atty Brabazon re: whether the community service has been completed. State indicates the community service was part of the DAGPA, not probation.  Court adjourns matter, will give counsel time to look into the community service issue. Defendant needs to appear in person for next hearing.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for February 6, 2017 at 02:00 pm.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Deferred Acceptance of Guilty Plea Agreement
Deferred Acceptance of Guilty Plea Agreement

Defendant Amy Rivera in court with attorney Shane Laughton Brabazon.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Cts. 1, 2 & 3. Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty of Cts. 1 & 3. Court withholds accepting of the plea on Ct. 2 to allow defendant time to complete terms of Deferred Acceptance of Guilty Plea Agreement.  Court reviews collateral consequences if defendant is found guilty of a felony. Court reviews agreement with defendant, approves and signs agreement. Upon successful completion of DAGPA, State will, after 2 years, amend Ct. 2 to Misd. Retail Theft and ask court to impose fine/costs in which defendant will have already paid. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Defendant makes statement, apologizes to the court. Bond remains in effect regarding Ct. 2.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for December 5, 2016 at 11:45 am.
from Atty Brabazon with character letters on defendants behalf.
Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea.  Bond remains as is.

Defendant Amy Rivera in court with attorney Shane Laughton Brabazon.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minute sheet.   Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.  Status conference scheduled for December 1, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 13, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
No contact direct or indirect with victims listed in complaint.

Defendant Amy Rivera in court with attorney Shane Laughton Brabazon.  Raymond L. Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to preliminary hearing. Defense waives reading of the complaint, waives time limit for prelim. Atty Brabazon requests a status date. Bond set.  Status conference scheduled for September 26, 2014 at 11:30 am.
Return of Officer and Acknowledgment of Return of Officer
Defendant was fingerprinted 6/26/14 by jail staff. (fingerprint card destroyed 12/05/14)
